findings.rationale: A 30-day termination notice may not provide sufficient time to transition or mitigate impacts, especially for ongoing business operations.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice for any reason.

findings.rationale: Limiting liability to fees paid in the past year could expose parties to significant risks in case of major claims or losses.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual subscription fees may leave parties vulnerable to larger claims that exceed this limit.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for its own breach, capped at annual subscription fees.

findings.rationale: An 18-month confidentiality obligation post-termination may not be sufficient for all sensitive information, risking potential exposure.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 18 months after termination.
